    • Method Detail

      • isA

        public static boolean isA(Class<?> what,
                          Class<?> interfaceOrSuper)
        Whether or not the 1st class is, or extends, or implements of the 2nd class. In other words, whether an instance of the 1st class can be assigned to a variable of the 2nd class.
        Parameters:
        what - The Class of the value of want to assign (the right-hand side of an assignment).
        interfaceOrSuper - The class of the variable you want to assign the value to (the left-hand side of an assignment).
        Returns:
        Whether or not the 1st class is, or extends, or implements of the 2nd class.

      • isA

        public static boolean isA(Object what,
                          Class<?> interfaceOrSuper)
        Whether or not the 1st argument is an instance of the 2nd argument.
        Parameters:
        what - The value to want to assign (the right-hand side of an assignment).
        interfaceOrSuper - The class of the variable you want to assign the value to (the left-hand side of an assignment).
        Returns:
        Whether or not you can assign "what" to a variable of type "target".

      • isPrimitiveNumber

        public static boolean isPrimitiveNumber(Object obj)
        Whether or not the specified object is a primitive number. Of course, an object never is a primitive, unless you got it from Field.get() or Method.invoke().
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to test
        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified object is a primitive number.

      • isPrimitiveNumber

        public static boolean isPrimitiveNumber(Class<?> c)
        Whether or not the specified Class is one of the primitive number types (int.class, float.class, etc.)
        Parameters:
        c - The Class to test The class you are interested in
        Returns:

      • isNumber

        Whether or not the specified object is a primitive number or a Number.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified Class is one of the primitive number classes

        Parameters:

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(Object obj)
        Whether or not the specified object is a number, or a character or string representing a number.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Whether the object can be represented as a number.
